MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ColumnOrderPreserved { get; set; }
member this.ColumnOrderPreserved : bool with get, set

Docs.param: use true to force GridLayout to respect the order of column boundaries.
Docs.summary: Returns whether or not column boundaries are ordered by their grid indices. -or- When this property is true, GridLayout is forced to place the column boundaries so that their associated grid indices are in ascending order in the view.
Docs.value: true if column boundaries must appear in the order of their indices, false otherwise

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Widget.GridOrientation Orientation { get; set; }
member this.Orientation : Android.Widget.GridOrientation with get, set

Docs.summary:
Returns the current orientation. -or- GridLayout uses the orientation property for two purposes:
To control the 'direction' in which default row/column indices are generated when they are not specified in a component's layout parameters.

Docs.param: true to force GridLayout to respect the order of row boundaries
Docs.summary: Returns whether or not row boundaries are ordered by their grid indices. -or- When this property is true, GridLayout is forced to place the row boundaries so that their associated grid indices are in ascending order in the view.
Docs.value: true if row boundaries must appear in the order of their indices, false otherwise

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool UseDefaultMargins { get; set; }
member this.UseDefaultMargins : bool with get, set

Docs.param: use true to make GridLayout allocate default margins
Docs.summary: Returns whether or not this GridLayout will allocate default margins when no corresponding layout parameters are defined. -or- When true, GridLayout allocates default margins around children based on the child's visual characteristics.
Docs.value: true if default margins should be allocated
